docs.lead_paragraph: 9 P.M. (NBC) THE APPRENTICEDonald Trump, above left, returns to the boardroom to help 16 candidates -- all unemployed -- get back to work. The contestants range from talented workers who have lost their jobs because of the economic downturn to recent college graduates with few, if any, prospects. But will Mr. Trump have the heart to fire the already downtrodden? Donald Trump Jr. and Ivanka Trump return as their father's advisers. The winner will be given a job with a six-figure salary within the Trump Organization. The first task in this two-hour 10th-season premiere: to create a modern work space. 8 P.M. (History) THE UNIVERSE A look at the movements of Earth, Moon and Sun that produce a total eclipse.

headline.main: Makers Seek New Name For a Syrup

docs.lead_paragraph: Would high-fructose corn syrup, by any other name, have sweeter appeal? The Corn Refiners Association, which represents firms that make the syrup, has been trying to improve the image of the much maligned sweetener with ad campaigns promoting it as a natural ingredient made from corn. Now, the group has petitioned the United States Food and Drug Administration to start calling the ingredient ''corn sugar,'' arguing that a name change is the only way to clear up consumer confusion about the product.
